author: The_Contrarian01
body:
Stock futures are mostly flat this morning. Tech is seeing a bit of selling, with the Nasdaq off 0.3%.

This follows a day of reopening optimism that lifted retail stocks. New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut will fully re-open on May 19. Florida is open effective immediately.

So the rotation trade is apparently back. Not much in the way of economic data today. Factory orders at 0830. We do have a bunch of earnings: CVS and DuPont just beat. Later we have Pfizer, Activision Blizzard, Akamai, and some oil majors: ConocoPhillips, Marathon Petroleum, Dominion Energy, Devon Energy. 

Oil is up this morning, by the way. Crude up 1.8% to $65.50, another post-pandemic high.

Looks like things might be melting up. Sell in May and go away at your peril. Not sure there was ever any real basis for that anyway. Just sounds good.

author: The_Contrarian01
body:
Good morning contrarians!

Stock futures are mostly flat this morning. Tech is seeing a bit of selling, with the Nasdaq off 0.3%.

This follows a day of reopening optimism that lifted retail stocks. New York, New Jersey, and Connecticut will fully re-open on May 19. Florida is open effective immediately.

So the rotation trade is apparently back. Not much in the way of economic data today. Factory orders at 0830. We do have a bunch of earnings: CVS and DuPont just beat. Later we have Pfizer, Activision Blizzard, Akamai, and some oil majors: ConocoPhillips, Marathon Petroleum, Dominion Energy, Devon Energy. 

Oil is up this morning, by the way. Crude up 1.8% to $65.50, another post-pandemic high.

Looks like things might be melting up. Sell in May and go away at your peril. Not sure there was ever any real basis for that anyway. Just sounds good.

author: redpandaeater
body:
AWS is huge but wouldn't say it dominates that market either. There is still plenty of competition like Alphabet, Microsoft, Cloudflare, and Akamai.

Admittedly I'm one to point out Standard Oil never dominated the market either.

author: scusemyenglish
body:
Thanks for this post! Genuine question - Why not Akamai? They're already established in the sector and their stock is trading at 2/3rds the price of Cloudflare despite having 7x the revenue and being profitable? Cloudflare only seems to have slightly better gross margins.

I know you say you don't look at financials, but also you don't want to be paying for a stock which already has massive growth for the next 3/4 years priced in.

Edit - I know nothing about the technicals of CDN and cloud service companies to be able to recognise which company has the better product outside of looking at reviews from CIO/CTO/IT Directors...

author: Don_Quixote2112
body: $TSLA anyone?  Clearly there’s not a penalty for overvaluation at present.  $NET is in a niche where few are doing it as well as they are.  If you look at web content caching, companies like Akamai and others have been in the game too long and are comfortable.  I like $NET for longevity because they are a disruptor.

author: superepicunicornturd
body: Finally akamai ain't lookin too bad anymore

author: F10andTheHotKeys
body: Hmm $AKAM got a little bounce ofter earnings, I wonder if they'll get back to $120's.  They actually have a P/E ratio listed. Neat. Don't see that often nowadays.
